nodes.id: 历史与阶级意识：关于马克思主义辩证法的研究

zh-cn: 历史与阶级意识：关于马克思主义辩证法的研究
en: History and Class Consciousness: Studies in Marxist Dialectics
Geschichte und Klassenbewußtsein. Studien über marxistische Dialektik

description.zh-cn: 匈牙利马克思主义哲学家卢卡奇·格奥尔格的主要著作，收录了他在1919年至1922年间撰写的8篇论文，被认为是西方马克思主义的奠基之作之一。
description.en: A major work by the Hungarian Marxist philosopher György Lukács, compiling eight essays written between 1919 and 1922, and is considered one of the foundational texts of Western Marxism.

description.zh-cn: 匈牙利马克思主义哲学家，《历史与阶级意识》的作者，被认为是西方马克思主义的创始人之一。
description.en: Hungarian Marxist philosopher, author of 'History and Class Consciousness', and considered one of the founders of Western Marxism.

description.zh-cn: 一种共产主义思潮，批评布尔什维克在十月革命后的政治实践。
description.en: A tendency in communist thought that criticizes the political practices of the Bolsheviks after the October Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 德国哲学家、社会主义者，马克思主义的创始人之一。
description.en: German philosopher, socialist, and one of the founders of Marxism.

description.zh-cn: 弗里德里希·恩格斯提出的一套理论，试图将马克思主义的辩证法应用于自然科学。
description.en: A theory proposed by Friedrich Engels attempting to apply Marxist dialectics to natural science.

nodes.id: 格奥尔格·威廉·弗里德里希·黑格尔

zh-cn: 格奥尔格·威廉·弗里德里希·黑格尔

description.zh-cn: 德国哲学家，德国古典哲学的集大成者。
description.en: German philosopher and a major figure in German idealism.

description.zh-cn: 一个社会学概念，指在资本主义社会中，人与人之间的社会关系被转化为物与物之间的关系，从而掩盖了社会关系的本质。
description.en: A sociological concept where social relations between people in a capitalist society are transformed into relations between things, thereby obscuring the true nature of these social relations.

description.zh-cn: 20世纪20年代以来在西欧和中欧发展起来的一种马克思主义思潮，强调马克思主义的哲学和文化层面。
description.en: A current of Marxist theory that arose from Western and Central Europe in the aftermath of the 1917 October Revolution, emphasizing the philosophical and cultural dimensions of Marxism.

nodes.id: 黑格尔主义的马克思主义

zh-cn: 黑格尔主义的马克思主义

description.zh-cn: 一种马克思主义流派，强调马克思思想中黑格尔哲学的根源和影响。
description.en: A school of Marxism that emphasizes the Hegelian philosophical roots and influences in Karl Marx's thought.

description.zh-cn: 马克思主义理论中的一个社会阶级，指在资本主义社会中不占有生产资料，靠出卖劳动力为生的雇佣工人阶级。
description.en: A social class in Marxist theory, referring to the wage-earning workers in a capitalist society who do not own the means of production and live by selling their labor power.

relationships.target: 历史与阶级意识：关于马克思主义辩证法的研究

description.zh-cn: 撰写并出版了《历史与阶级意识：关于马克思主义辩证法的研究》。
description.en: Authored and published 'History and Class Consciousness: Studies in Marxist Dialectics'.

relationships.target: 历史与阶级意识：关于马克思主义辩证法的研究

description.zh-cn: 《历史与阶级意识》反映了当时国际共产主义运动中出现的“左翼共产主义”倾向。
description.en: 'History and Class Consciousness' reflects the 'Left Communism' tendency that emerged in the international communist movement at the time.

relationships.target: 历史与阶级意识：关于马克思主义辩证法的研究

description.zh-cn: 第一次世界大战后资本主义面临的严重危机，是卢卡奇撰写该书的历史背景。
description.en: The severe crisis faced by capitalism after World War I formed the historical context for Lukács's writing of the book.

relationships.target: 历史与阶级意识：关于马克思主义辩证法的研究

description.zh-cn: 俄国十月革命的影响是卢卡奇撰写该书的历史背景之一。
description.en: The influence of the Russian October Revolution was part of the historical context for Lukács's writing of the book.

relationships.source: 历史与阶级意识：关于马克思主义辩证法的研究

description.zh-cn: 该书系统地重新审视和解释了马克思主义，将其视为一种社会理论。
description.en: The book systematically re-examines and interprets Marxism, treating it as a social theory.

description.zh-cn: 在《历史与阶级意识》中，卢卡奇批评恩格斯将辩证法扩展到自然界是受到黑格尔的错误引导，会削弱辩证法的革命性。
description.en: In 'History and Class Consciousness', Lukács criticized Engels's extension of dialectics to nature as being misguided by Hegel, which would weaken the revolutionary nature of the dialectic.

description.zh-cn: 在《历史与阶级意识》中，卢卡奇否定“自然辩证法”，认为辩证法仅适用于社会历史领域。
description.en: In 'History and Class Consciousness', Lukács rejected the 'Dialectics of Nature', arguing that dialectics only apply to the socio-historical realm.

relationships.source: 格奥尔格·威廉·弗里德里希·黑格尔

description.zh-cn: 根据卢卡奇的观点，恩格斯将辩证法扩展到自然界是受到了黑格尔的错误引导。
description.en: According to Lukács's view, Engels was misguided by Hegel in extending dialectics to nature.

relationships.source: 格奥尔格·威廉·弗里德里希·黑格尔

description.zh-cn: 卢卡奇借用了黑格尔的“总体性”概念来分析资本主义，其思想被认为受到“黑格尔主义”的影响。
description.en: Lukács borrowed Hegel's concept of 'totality' to analyze capitalism, and his thought is considered to be influenced by 'Hegelianism'.

description.zh-cn: 根据卢卡奇在《历史与阶级意识》中的分析，物化是生活在资本主义社会中的每个人直接面对的现实。
description.en: According to Lukács's analysis in 'History and Class Consciousness', reification is a reality directly faced by everyone living in capitalist society.

relationships.target: 历史与阶级意识：关于马克思主义辩证法的研究

description.zh-cn: 《历史与阶级意识》出版后，很快遭到共产国际的批判。
description.en: After its publication, 'History and Class Consciousness' was soon criticized by the Communist International.

description.zh-cn: 因其著作《历史与阶级意识》受到共产国际批判，卢卡奇被撤销在匈牙利国共产党中的领导职务。
description.en: Due to the criticism of his work 'History and Class Consciousness' by the Communist International, Lukács was removed from his leadership position in the Communist Party of Hungary.

description.zh-cn: 曾在匈牙利国共产党中担任领导职务，后因其著作被批判而遭撤职。
description.en: Held a leadership position in the Communist Party of Hungary, but was later dismissed after his book was criticized.

description.zh-cn: 因其著作《历史与阶级意识》，卢卡奇被视为“西方马克思主义”的创始人。
description.en: Due to his work 'History and Class Consciousness', Lukács is regarded as the founder of 'Western Marxism'.

relationships.source: 黑格尔主义的马克思主义
relationships.target: 历史与阶级意识：关于马克思主义辩证法的研究

description.zh-cn: 该书所表现出来的思想被认为是“黑格尔主义的马克思主义”的一种。
description.en: The ideas expressed in the book are considered a form of 'Hegelian Marxism'.

relationships.target: 历史与阶级意识：关于马克思主义辩证法的研究

description.zh-cn: 在1967年该书再版的序言中对书中的某些观点进行了自我批评。
description.en: In the preface to the 1967 re-edition of the book, he engaged in self-criticism regarding certain viewpoints expressed in it.

relationships.source: 历史与阶级意识：关于马克思主义辩证法的研究

description.zh-cn: 该书认为只有无产阶级才能理解和掌握总体性辩证法，并承担起从总体上认识和改造社会的历史任务。
description.en: The book argues that only the proletariat can understand and master the dialectic of totality and undertake the historical task of understanding and transforming society as a whole.
